studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Addition of footnote text stating that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Correction of number of days from 30 days to 21 days regarding zinc discontinuation timing
Addition of text applicable only to the US detailing the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol
To facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study

studyChanges.afterText: Procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
studyChanges.summary: Added footnote text to Schedule of Activities table referencing US-specific screening site procedures in Section 8

studyChanges.beforeText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: Changed zinc discontinuation timing from 30 days to 21 days to align with other protocol references

studyChanges.afterText: Text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures
studyChanges.summary: Added US-specific text allowing certain sites to perform only screening procedures to facilitate recruitment across different US regions
